result.execSummary:
The defendant Tommy Dean Katherine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tommy Dean Katherine is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tommy Dean Katherine was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Tommy Dean Katherine was found guilty of Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under the Influence of Intoxicant) [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO THIS CASE:  Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
Court waives the DV surcharge due to defendant's inability to pay.

Provide biological specimen for DNA analysis.
Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count count.  **10/12/2015  credit of 161 days.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under the Influence of Intoxicant)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tommy Dean Katherine

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript (28 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER 17, 2015 received and filed.
Count two, per Order signed on October 12, 2015:  JOC shall be amended to include 161 days of sentence credit on count two.

received, signed and filed amending judgment of conviction.
Copies forwarded to parties on today's date.
cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify sentence credit on count two.
Count two.
Count one.

Defendant Tommy Dean Katherine in court with Attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant Tommy Dean Katherine in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds there is a basis for habitual criminality enhancer.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State and defense counsel.  COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  9 years with  161  days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  54  months -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  54  months.

As to Count 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9  months in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Count 1.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court WAIVES the DV surcharge due to defendant's inability to pay

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Clerk:  jms

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
D248B (brown folio)

Defendant Tommy Dean Katherine in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant Tommy Dean Katherine in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Jury trial continued...
.
      
Jury in box.  
Sworn for the State:   Police Officer McGrath, Lee Vedvrraaden, MPD Investigator.
Exhibits 4 through 18 offered and received.
Defense motion to dismiss all counts is granted in part and denied in part.
Court grants the defense request as to counts 3 and 4 but denies defense request as to counts 1 and 2.
State rests subject to rebuttal.
Defense rests.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Court instructs the jury.  Court charged the jury. Jury retired to deliberate at the hour of 2:15 p.m. in care of Deputies Lisa Freuck and Randal Takacs.

.

On the same day at the hour of 3:50 p.m.the jury returned and by the Foreperson brought in a verdict that was then and there read by the Court.  Court polled the jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  Jury verdict received and filed. Jury discharged.  Motions after the verdict heard. 
Case adjourned for a sentencing date in Branch 36 on 09/17/2015 at 01:30 pm
Defendant remanded.

Attorney Robert W. Buckett in court, defendant Tommy Dean Katherine not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties proceed to impanel a jury.  Jury duly impanelled and sworn to try the issues in this case.  
Jury list filed.  Jury impaneled. 
Jury list received and filed.
Jury sworn to try the issue.
Jury out of box.
Jury in box.
The Court instructed the jury.
Opening statements by counsel.
Trial proceeded and proofs submitted.
Sworn for the State:  Nicole Sprewer and Marilyn Dejohnett, 911 operators.
Exhibit 1 offered and received.
The court will adjourn for the day.  The jurors were instructed to return to court at 09:00 a.m. in the morning.
  Jury trial scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Robert W. Buckett in court.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was not produced today.
Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 08/17/2015 at 08:30 a.m.
All offers are revoked.
STATE SUBPOENA FOR AUGUST 17, 2015 @ 8:30 AM RECEIVED AND FILED

Attorney Robert W. Buckett in court, defendant Tommy Dean Katherine not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial. Court adjourned case for Final Pretrial prior to Jury Trial date of 8/17/2015.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Robert W. Buckett in court, defendant Tommy Dean Katherine not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Tommy Dean Katherine in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant Tommy Dean Katherine in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called at 1:30 PM.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Ryan Ballogh.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #09CF2729 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
 No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with:  Sheila M; Susie T; DCCT ( 2/15/99).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tommy Dean Katherine in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Tommy Dean Katherine in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. 
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to all Misdemeanor Counts.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing/ Bailbond hearing  scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
